snippet: The federal government paid almost $1 million on Monday for part of a South Texas nature preserve that was taken for the border fence, ending nearly four years of litigation.
abstract: Federal government pays almost $1 million for part of a nature preserve in Brownsville, Tex, that was taken for the border fence, ending nearly four years of litigation with the Nature Conservancy.
lead_paragraph: The federal government paid almost $1 million on Monday for part of a South Texas nature preserve that was taken for the border fence, ending nearly four years of litigation.

headline.seo: Texas: Conservancy to Be Paid for Border Fence
headline.main: Texas: Conservancy to Be Paid for Fence
headline.print_headline: Texas: Conservancy To Be Paid For Fence
